subject: Productivity
title: The Cost of Sleep Deprivation
description: A quick win: understand The Cost of Sleep Deprivation.

hook.text: The Chernobyl disaster, Exxon Valdez oil spill, and Challenger explosion all involved sleep-deprived workers.

buildup.text: The CDC calls insufficient sleep a public health epidemic. A third of adults sleep less than seven hours.

discovery.text: Sleep loss costs the US economy $411 billion annually in reduced productivity and increased errors.

twist.text: People who sleep six hours think they're fine. Tests show their performance equals someone legally drunk.

climax.text: Sleep deprivation is the hidden tax on every organization. It reduces output while people think they're coping.

punchline.text: Sleep debt is invisible. Its consequences are not.

quiz.question: How much does sleep loss cost the US economy annually?
